Ammonia was not detected in the experimental set-up used to characterise the leachate, probably due to excessive moisture in the atmosphere, especially during the night. Therefore, this excess water in Ogawa passive samplers could have prevented the ammonia from being retained in the filter, because ammonia is very soluble in water. A specific experiment was conducted to determine ammonia emissions from a more alkaline leachate (pH ca. 8), by using the MX6 Ibrid portable detector in a small vessel. The ammonia concentration was one quarter that of hydrogen sulphide (NH3: 8ppmv; H2S: 32ppmv).
